title: 112_s3638
content: The "Today's Entrepreneurs are Advancing Mentorship Act of 2012" or the "TEAM Act of 2012" establishes the Office of Entrepreneurial Support under the Small Business Act. This office aims to provide support for entrepreneurs. The Office of Entrepreneurial Support, established under the Small Business Act, provides innovative information, education, and resources to promote entrepreneurs and small businesses. The Director manages online courses and resources for entrepreneurs. The Office of Entrepreneurial Support, established under the Small Business Act, provides innovative information, education, and resources to promote entrepreneurs and small businesses. The Director manages online courses and resources for entrepreneurs, coordinates youth entrepreneurship programs, shares educational materials on money management and financial literacy, and provides assistance to small business concerns. The Office of Entrepreneurial Support, established under the Small Business Act, offers assistance and courtesy services to individuals and foreign dignitaries interested in entrepreneurship and small business issues. The Associate Administrator for Entrepreneurial Development can provide grants to nonprofit organizations, small business development centers, women's business centers, and other partners for entrepreneurial support programs. The Associate Administrator provides grants to entities for developing and implementing curricula and mentoring programs to promote entrepreneurship. Entities must submit an application outlining project goals, partners involved, and any other necessary information. A report is required within one year of receiving the grant. Entities receiving grants must submit a report detailing individuals assisted, jobs created or saved, and any other required information. Authorization of appropriations is set at $1,000,000 for 2013, $2,000,000 for 2014, and $3,000,000 for 2015. The Director of the Office of Entrepreneurial Support must submit a report on best practices of entrepreneurial education and training programs in the US within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The report should include descriptions of exemplary national, regional, state, and local programs. The report on entrepreneurial education and training programs should include details on programs conducted by the Federal Government, State and local governments, nonprofit organizations, and private sector groups. The Emerging Leaders Program is established under Section 3. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Emerging Leaders Program, defining eligible small business concerns and the program itself. The Small Business Act is amended to establish the Emerging Leaders Program, providing specialized training and mentoring to eligible small businesses for growth and leadership development. The Administrator of the Emerging Leaders Program can enter contracts with national service providers and collaborate with various entities for localized training and mentoring. Special emphasis is placed on recruiting small businesses in emerging, underserved, rural, and urban markets. The Emerging Leaders Program can receive $2,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2013 through 2015 to support small businesses in emerging, underserved, rural, and urban markets. SEC. 4. PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND REPORTING. The Administrator will develop performance measures for the Emerging Leaders Program and the Entrepreneurial Support Program. Information on program participation, grant applicants, recipients, demographics, and business locations will be collected and posted on the Administration's website. The Administrator will collect and post information on program participation, grant applicants, recipients, demographics, and business locations. This includes details such as the annual revenues, jobs created, new financing, contracts obtained, and Federal tax paid by each participating small business concern. The GAO Report must be submitted within 2 years of establishing the Emerging Leaders Program, analyzing its economic impact and the Entrepreneurial Support Program for the Senate and House Committees on Small Business.
